column1: Le Chesnay (French: [lə.ʃɛnɛ] (listen)) is a former commune in the Yvelines department in the Île-de-France region in north-central France. On 1 January 2019
column2: it was merged into the new commune Le Chesnay-Rocquencourt. It is located in the western suburbs of Paris
column3: 16.7 km (10.4 mi) from the center of Paris.

column2: Napoleon's Grande Armée fought its last battle in Rocquencourt and Le Chesnay.  After the defeat of Waterloo on 18 June 1815
column3: Grouchy's army withdrew to Paris via Namur and Dinant
column5: a few days before the Prussians

column2: Exelmans was ordered to attack the Prussians at Versailles on 1 July 1815. Under attack the Prussians retreated from Versailles and headed east
column3: but were blocked by the French at Vélizy.  They failed to re-enter Versailles and headed for Saint-Germain-en-Laye.  Their first squadron came under fire at the entrance of Rocquencourt and attempted to escape through the fields.  They were forced into a small
column4: narrow street in Le Chesnay and killed or captured.  However
column5: the main body of the Prussian army succeeded in reaching Saint-Germain. (From Presentation of Rocquencourt)

column1: Le Chesnay is served by no station of the Paris Métro
column3: or suburban rail network. The closest station to Le Chesnay is Versailles – Rive Droite station on the Transilien Paris – Saint-Lazare suburban rail line. This station is located in the neighboring city of Versailles
column4: 2 km (1.2 mi) from the town center of Le Chesnay.

column2: the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints opened its first temple in Metropolitan France to the public prior to its dedication on May 21
column3: 2017. The Paris France Temple is located in Le Chesnay with grounds abutting the gardens of the Château de Versailles. The Pape'ete Tahiti Temple was built earlier and is in Overseas France

Lycée Jean Moulin - Senior high school/sixth form collegeThe commune is also served by senior high schools/sixth form colleges in Versailles: Lycée La Bruyère
column5: and Lycée Jacques-Prévert.There is one private school
column7: with a preschool and elementary school campus
column8: and a junior high school and senior high school campus.Universities:
